title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: First, let’s load required packages:
code: library(uscis) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: First, need initialize session USCIS get necessary cookies: Let’s retrieve list available USCIS forms: form, can get available subtypes: Now let’s get offices process form type: Finally, let’s get current processing times. example, let’s just look subset forms keep API calls manageable:
code: uscis_init_session() #> [1] TRUE forms <- uscis_forms() head(forms) #>                                                                 form_description_en #> 1       Application for Replacement/Initial Nonimmigrant Arrival-Departure Document #> 2                                                Petition for a Nonimmigrant Worker #> 3                         Petition for a CNMI-Only Nonimmigrant Transitional Worker #> 4                                                      Petition for Alien Fiancé(e) #> 5                                                       Petition for Alien Relative #> 6 Application for Travel Documents, Parole Documents, and Arrival/Departure Records #>                                                                                  form_description_es #> 1                     Solicitud para Reemplazar/Obtener Documento de Entrada/Salida de No Inmigrante #> 2                                                               Petición de Trabajador No Inmigrante #> 3                                   Petición de Trabajador Transicional No Inmigrante – Solo de CNMI #> 4                                                            Petición de Prometido(a) Extranjero (2) #> 5                                                                    Petición de Familiar Extranjero #> 6 Solicitud de Documentos de Viaje, Documentos de Libertad Condicional y Registros de Entrada/Salida #>   form_name #> 1     I-102 #> 2     I-129 #> 3   I-129CW #> 4    I-129F #> 5     I-130 #> 6     I-131 form_types <- uscis_form_types(forms) head(form_types) #>   form_name form_key form_type #> 1     I-102      142       142 #> 2     I-129    137-E     137-E #> 3     I-129   137-E3    137-E3 #> 4     I-129 137-H1B1  137-H1B1 #> 5     I-129 137-H1B2  137-H1B2 #> 6     I-129 137-H1B3  137-H1B3 #>                                      form_type_description_en #> 1              Initial issuance or replacement of a Form I-94 #> 2                            E - Treaty traders and investors #> 3            E3 - Specialty occupation workers from Australia #> 4      H-1B - Specialty occupation - Visa to be issued abroad #> 5  H-1B - Specialty occupation - Change of status in the U.S. #> 6 H-1B - Specialty occupation - Extension of stay in the U.S. #>                                                        form_type_description_es #> 1                               Emisión o reemplazo inicial del Formulario I-94 #> 2                                             E - Comerciantes e inversionistas #> 3                 E-3 para Trabajadores Australianos en Trabajos Especializados #> 4               H-1B - Ocupación especial - visa que se expedirá en el exterior #> 5 H-1B - Ocupación especial - cambio de la condición migratoria en los E.E.U.U. #> 6           H-1B - Ocupación especial - extensión de la estadía en los E.E.U.U. form_offices <- uscis_form_offices(form_types) head(form_offices) #>   form_name form_type office_code        office_description #> 1     I-102       142         CSC California Service Center #> 2     I-102       142         NBC  National Benefits Center #> 3     I-102       142         NSC   Nebraska Service Center #> 4     I-102       142         SSC      Texas Service Center #> 5     I-102       142         ESC    Vermont Service Center #> 6     I-129     137-E         CSC California Service Center # Let's look at just I-130 forms as an example i130_offices <- form_offices |>   filter(form_name == "I-130")  processing_times <- uscis_processing_times(i130_offices) head(processing_times) #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   form_name form_subtype office_code publication_date form_note_en form_note_es #>   <fct>     <fct>        <fct>       <chr>            <lgl>        <lgl>        #> 1 I-130     134A-F21     SCD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 2 I-130     134A-F21     NBC         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 3 I-130     134A-F21     FOD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 4 I-130     134A-IR      SCD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 5 I-130     134A-IR      NBC         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 6 I-130     134A-IR      FOD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> # ℹ 7 more variables: range_upper <dbl>, range_upper_unit <fct>, #> #   range_lower <dbl>, range_lower_unit <fct>, service_request_date <chr>, #> #   subtype_info_en <chr>, subtype_info_es <chr>

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: First, need initialize session USCIS get necessary cookies:
code: uscis_init_session() #> [1] TRUE

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: Let’s retrieve list available USCIS forms:
code: forms <- uscis_forms() head(forms) #>                                                                 form_description_en #> 1       Application for Replacement/Initial Nonimmigrant Arrival-Departure Document #> 2                                                Petition for a Nonimmigrant Worker #> 3                         Petition for a CNMI-Only Nonimmigrant Transitional Worker #> 4                                                      Petition for Alien Fiancé(e) #> 5                                                       Petition for Alien Relative #> 6 Application for Travel Documents, Parole Documents, and Arrival/Departure Records #>                                                                                  form_description_es #> 1                     Solicitud para Reemplazar/Obtener Documento de Entrada/Salida de No Inmigrante #> 2                                                               Petición de Trabajador No Inmigrante #> 3                                   Petición de Trabajador Transicional No Inmigrante – Solo de CNMI #> 4                                                            Petición de Prometido(a) Extranjero (2) #> 5                                                                    Petición de Familiar Extranjero #> 6 Solicitud de Documentos de Viaje, Documentos de Libertad Condicional y Registros de Entrada/Salida #>   form_name #> 1     I-102 #> 2     I-129 #> 3   I-129CW #> 4    I-129F #> 5     I-130 #> 6     I-131

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: form, can get available subtypes:
code: form_types <- uscis_form_types(forms) head(form_types) #>   form_name form_key form_type #> 1     I-102      142       142 #> 2     I-129    137-E     137-E #> 3     I-129   137-E3    137-E3 #> 4     I-129 137-H1B1  137-H1B1 #> 5     I-129 137-H1B2  137-H1B2 #> 6     I-129 137-H1B3  137-H1B3 #>                                      form_type_description_en #> 1              Initial issuance or replacement of a Form I-94 #> 2                            E - Treaty traders and investors #> 3            E3 - Specialty occupation workers from Australia #> 4      H-1B - Specialty occupation - Visa to be issued abroad #> 5  H-1B - Specialty occupation - Change of status in the U.S. #> 6 H-1B - Specialty occupation - Extension of stay in the U.S. #>                                                        form_type_description_es #> 1                               Emisión o reemplazo inicial del Formulario I-94 #> 2                                             E - Comerciantes e inversionistas #> 3                 E-3 para Trabajadores Australianos en Trabajos Especializados #> 4               H-1B - Ocupación especial - visa que se expedirá en el exterior #> 5 H-1B - Ocupación especial - cambio de la condición migratoria en los E.E.U.U. #> 6           H-1B - Ocupación especial - extensión de la estadía en los E.E.U.U.

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: Now let’s get offices process form type:
code: form_offices <- uscis_form_offices(form_types) head(form_offices) #>   form_name form_type office_code        office_description #> 1     I-102       142         CSC California Service Center #> 2     I-102       142         NBC  National Benefits Center #> 3     I-102       142         NSC   Nebraska Service Center #> 4     I-102       142         SSC      Texas Service Center #> 5     I-102       142         ESC    Vermont Service Center #> 6     I-129     137-E         CSC California Service Center

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: Finally, let’s get current processing times. example, let’s just look subset forms keep API calls manageable:
code: # Let's look at just I-130 forms as an example i130_offices <- form_offices |>   filter(form_name == "I-130")  processing_times <- uscis_processing_times(i130_offices) head(processing_times) #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   form_name form_subtype office_code publication_date form_note_en form_note_es #>   <fct>     <fct>        <fct>       <chr>            <lgl>        <lgl>        #> 1 I-130     134A-F21     SCD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 2 I-130     134A-F21     NBC         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 3 I-130     134A-F21     FOD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 4 I-130     134A-IR      SCD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 5 I-130     134A-IR      NBC         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 6 I-130     134A-IR      FOD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> # ℹ 7 more variables: range_upper <dbl>, range_upper_unit <fct>, #> #   range_lower <dbl>, range_lower_unit <fct>, service_request_date <chr>, #> #   subtype_info_en <chr>, subtype_info_es <chr>

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: Let’s turn now basic analysis processing times data. begin, let’s standardize times months: Let’s create boxplot showing distribution processing times form:  visualization shows overall distribution processing times form type, helping identify forms typically take longer process. can also break processing office see variations processing times across locations:  can refine analysis looking specific form subtypes:  visualization, can: Identify offices consistently faster slower processing times Understand variation processing times specific forms Plan application submissions based office processing speeds can also analyze offices generally faster slower across forms: Fastest Processing Offices (Average Across Forms)
code: processing_in_months <- standardize_to_months(processing_times) head(processing_in_months) #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   form_name form_subtype office_code publication_date form_note_en form_note_es #>   <fct>     <fct>        <fct>       <chr>            <lgl>        <lgl>        #> 1 I-130     134A-F21     SCD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 2 I-130     134A-F21     NBC         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 3 I-130     134A-F21     FOD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 4 I-130     134A-IR      SCD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 5 I-130     134A-IR      NBC         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> 6 I-130     134A-IR      FOD         October 18, 2024 NA           NA           #> # ℹ 7 more variables: range_upper <dbl>, range_upper_unit <chr>, #> #   range_lower <dbl>, range_lower_unit <chr>, service_request_date <chr>, #> #   subtype_info_en <chr>, subtype_info_es <chr> ggplot(data = processing_in_months) +   aes(x = form_name, y = range_upper) +    geom_boxplot() +   labs(     title = "Upper Range of Time (Months) for I-130 Form Across Offices",      subtitle = "Based on USCIS Processing Times",      y = "Months",     x = "Form"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1)) ggplot(data = processing_in_months) +    aes(x = reorder(office_code, range_upper), y = range_upper, color = office_code) +    geom_boxplot() +   labs(     title = "Upper Range of Time (Months) for the I-130 Form",      subtitle = "By Processing Office",      caption = "Based on USCIS Processing Times",     y = "Months",     x = "Form",     color = "Office"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1)) ggplot(data = processing_in_months) +    aes(x = reorder(office_code, range_upper), y = range_upper, fill = office_code) +    geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   facet_wrap(~ form_subtype, scales = "free", ncol = 2) +   labs(     title = "Upper Range of Time (Months) for the I-130 Form Across Subtypes",      subtitle = "By Processing Office",     caption = "Based on USCIS Processing Times",     y = "Months",     x = "Form",     color = "Office"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1)) office_summary <- processing_in_months |>   group_by(office_code) |>   summarise(     mean_processing_time = mean(range_upper, na.rm = TRUE),     median_processing_time = median(range_upper, na.rm = TRUE),     n_forms = n()   ) |>   arrange(mean_processing_time)  head(office_summary) |>   knitr::kable(     caption = "Fastest Processing Offices (Average Across All Forms)",     digits = 1   ) processing_times |>   summarise(     mean_upper = mean(range_upper),     mean_lower = mean(range_lower),     median_upper = median(range_upper),     median_lower = median(range_lower),     n_offices = n()   ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   mean_upper mean_lower median_upper median_lower n_offices #>        <dbl>      <dbl>        <dbl>        <dbl>     <int> #> 1       93.9       75.0         81.8         59.5        18

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: Let’s create boxplot showing distribution processing times form:  visualization shows overall distribution processing times form type, helping identify forms typically take longer process.
code: ggplot(data = processing_in_months) +   aes(x = form_name, y = range_upper) +    geom_boxplot() +   labs(     title = "Upper Range of Time (Months) for I-130 Form Across Offices",      subtitle = "Based on USCIS Processing Times",      y = "Months",     x = "Form"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1))

what: Processing Times by Form and Office
title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: can also break processing office see variations processing times across locations:
code: ggplot(data = processing_in_months) +    aes(x = reorder(office_code, range_upper), y = range_upper, color = office_code) +    geom_boxplot() +   labs(     title = "Upper Range of Time (Months) for the I-130 Form",      subtitle = "By Processing Office",      caption = "Based on USCIS Processing Times",     y = "Months",     x = "Form",     color = "Office"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1))

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: can refine analysis looking specific form subtypes:  visualization, can: Identify offices consistently faster slower processing times Understand variation processing times specific forms Plan application submissions based office processing speeds
code: ggplot(data = processing_in_months) +    aes(x = reorder(office_code, range_upper), y = range_upper, fill = office_code) +    geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   facet_wrap(~ form_subtype, scales = "free", ncol = 2) +   labs(     title = "Upper Range of Time (Months) for the I-130 Form Across Subtypes",      subtitle = "By Processing Office",     caption = "Based on USCIS Processing Times",     y = "Months",     x = "Form",     color = "Office"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1))

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: can also analyze offices generally faster slower across forms: Fastest Processing Offices (Average Across Forms)
code: office_summary <- processing_in_months |>   group_by(office_code) |>   summarise(     mean_processing_time = mean(range_upper, na.rm = TRUE),     median_processing_time = median(range_upper, na.rm = TRUE),     n_forms = n()   ) |>   arrange(mean_processing_time)  head(office_summary) |>   knitr::kable(     caption = "Fastest Processing Offices (Average Across All Forms)",     digits = 1   )

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
code: processing_times |>   summarise(     mean_upper = mean(range_upper),     mean_lower = mean(range_lower),     median_upper = median(range_upper),     median_lower = median(range_lower),     n_offices = n()   ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   mean_upper mean_lower median_upper median_lower n_offices #>        <dbl>      <dbl>        <dbl>        <dbl>     <int> #> 1       93.9       75.0         81.8         59.5        18

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: can save retrieved data CSV files later use: allow analyze data across time share others.
code: write.csv(   processing_times,   file = paste0("processing-times-", Sys.Date(), ".csv"),   row.names = FALSE )

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times
text: get authentication errors, try running init_uscis_session() API may rate limits, consider adding delays requests large queries Processing times data updated periodically USCIS, results may vary Important actual data may vary vignette built since USCIS updates processing times randomly.

title: Getting Started with USCIS Processing Times

title: USCIS Immigration Form Processing Times
text: [!IMPORTANT] project affiliated government agency considered official means. repository contains study programmatically obtaining processing time data various immigration forms U.S. Citizenship Immigration Services (USCIS) using R programming language. Historical median processing information fiscal years shared USCIS https://egov.uscis.gov/processing-times/historic-pt Information obtained making standard HTTPS requests processing time form makes communicate USCIS Processing Time API found : can see example workflow obtaining -485 processing time data Chicago, IL following GIF: Web API Responses USCIS Processing Times Source: https://.imgur.com/K9OalZF.gif
code: https://egov.uscis.gov/processing-times/api/

title: USCIS Immigration Form Processing Times
text: uscis package GitHub-package. can install package GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("coatless-r-n-d/uscis-processing")

title: USCIS Immigration Form Processing Times
text: package provides set functions interact USCIS Processing Time API. following brief overview functions available: uscis_init_session(): Initializes USCIS session. uscis_forms(): Retrieves available USCIS forms. uscis_form_types(): Retrieves available subtypes USCIS form. uscis_form_offices(): Retrieves processing offices form type. uscis_processing_times(): Retrieves current processing times USCIS forms. API designed mirror steps taken USCIS Processing Time website. functions also designed used pipeline fashion retrieve desired information.
code: # Load the library library(uscis)  # Initialize USCIS session uscis_init_session()  # Retrieve USCIS forms forms <- uscis_forms()  # Retrieve form types based on form names form_types <- uscis_form_types(forms)  # Retrieve processing offices for each form type offices <- uscis_form_offices(form_types)  # Retrieve processing times for each form and office processing_times <- uscis_processing_times(offices)

title: USCIS Immigration Form Processing Times
text: like take moment express gratitude appreciation USCIS team hard work dedication reviewing processing immigration forms. tireless efforts help individuals families around world realize dreams build new lives United States. Thank service community making positive impact many lives.

title: USCIS Immigration Form Processing Times
text: Retrieved processing time information USCIS extensively studied, lack focus utilizing R programming language purpose. non-exhaustive examples prior projects, please see: Ariel Rodriguez Romero’s exploration API endpoints Data Democracy’s immigration-connect (Python) Hemanth Makkapati’s uscis-tracker (Go) Gregor Martynus’s uscis-service-center-processing-times (Node) Andrew Duberstein’s uscis-wait-times (Python) J. Zebedee’s uscis (SQL)

what: uscis: USCIS Immigration Form Processing Times — uscis-package
title: uscis: USCIS Immigration Form Processing Times — uscis-package
text: Provides functions access analyze USCIS (United States Citizenship Immigration Services) processing times data API. Includes functionality retrieve form information, office locations, current processing times various immigration forms.

title: uscis: USCIS Immigration Form Processing Times — uscis-package
text: Maintainer: James Joseph Balamuta balamut2@illinois.edu

title: USCIS Processing Times — uscis_processing_times
text: form_offices Data frame uscis_form_offices() cookie_file Path cookie file

title: USCIS Processing Times — uscis_processing_times
text: tibble following columns: form_name Factor. name/identifier USCIS form form_subtype Factor. subtype form processed office_code Factor. USCIS office location code publication_date Character. Date processing time information published form_note_en Character NA. Additional form notes English form_note_es Character NA. Additional form notes Spanish range_upper Numeric. Upper bound processing time range range_upper_unit Factor. Time unit upper bound (e.g., "Months", "Days") range_lower Numeric. Lower bound processing time range range_lower_unit Factor. Time unit lower bound (e.g., "Months", "Days") service_request_date Character. Date service request can submitted outside normal processing time subtype_info_en Character. Additional information form subtype English subtype_info_es Character. Additional information form subtype Spanish

title: USCIS Processing Times — uscis_processing_times
text: date fields returned character format may need converted Date objects. Factor columns created optimize memory usage ensure consistent categories across dataset.

title: USCIS Processing Times — uscis_processing_times
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Initialize USCIS session uscis_init_session()  # Retrieve USCIS forms forms <- uscis_forms()  # Retrieve form types based on form names form_types <- uscis_form_types(forms)  # Retrieve processing offices for each form type offices <- uscis_form_offices(form_types)  # Retrieve processing times for each form and office processing_times <- uscis_processing_times(offices) head(processing_times) } # }
